meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or expressing a salutation or greeting.
meanings.sent1: The salutatory message on the card made her smile.
meanings.sent2: The salutatory handshake was warm and friendly.
meanings.sent3: The parrot gave a salutatory squawk when we entered the room.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays had a salutatory effect on the frost, melting it away.
meanings.sent5: The salutatory banner at the entrance welcomed all guests to the party.

meanings.sent1: The salutatory speech at the event set a positive tone.
meanings.sent2: She gave a salutatory nod to acknowledge his presence.
meanings.sent3: The cat's purring was a salutatory sound as we arrived home.
meanings.sent4: The first sip of hot cocoa was a salutatory experience on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The salutatory smile on her face made everyone feel at ease.

meanings.definition: Marked by or conveying a greeting or salutation.
meanings.sent1: The salutatory gesture of waving hello was endearing.
meanings.sent2: His salutatory email expressed gratitude for the opportunity.
meanings.sent3: The chirping birds provided a salutatory soundtrack to the morning.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in full bloom gave a salutatory welcome to spring.
meanings.sent5: The salutatory atmosphere of the party made everyone feel welcome.
